DOCNAME: CASE OF STAUDER AND GABL v. AUSTRIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
JUDGES: Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The second applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG ( PERSON , “ the ORG ” ) instituted preliminary investigations ( FAC ) against the CARDINAL applicants and several other persons on account of the suspicion of aggravated fraud ( schwerer gewerbsmässiger FAC ) by having set up and managed an internationally operated gambling system which was based on a pyramid scheme .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that the proceedings against the applicants were to be separated from those of the co - suspects to avoid delays .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an international arrest warrant ( Steckbrief ) in respect of the first applicant . He was in detention on remand from DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant filed a request for the acceleration of the proceedings under LAW of LAW ( Fristsetzungsantrag ) . ORG ( Oberlandesgericht , “ the Court of Appeal ” ) dismissed the request on DATE , stating that it could only be directed against delays caused by the courts , not ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the first applicant of all charges . The decision was served on his counsel on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an international arrest warrant in respect of the second applicant . He was in detention on remand from DATE until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the preliminary investigations against the second applicant were closed and the file was transferred to ORG , “ the Public Prosecutor ” ) for further processing . However , no indictment was brought against him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant filed a request for the acceleration of the proceedings under LAW of LAW . ORG dismissed the request on DATE , stating that it could only be directed against delays caused by the courts , not ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG brought an indictment against the second applicant . The second applicant lodged an appeal against the indictment and a motion requesting the discontinuation of the proceedings . On DATE ORG rejected the indictment , but did not discontinue the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings against the second applicant .
